text: Al-Nasr (; Arabic for "Victory") was a Hazara militant group, opposed to the leftist Afghan government during the 1980s. After the Revolutionary Council of Islamic Unity of Afghanistan, Al-Nasr was the elite militant group. The organisation included many young men educated in Kabul, including Shia clergymen, and received support from the Khomeini government.J. Bruce Amstutz . Afghanistan: The First Five Years of Soviet Occupation. DIANE Publishing, 1994. , It was a part of the Tehran Eight political constellation. ==References== Category:1980s in Afghanistan Category:Tehran Eight Nasr Category:Shia Islamist groups Category:Hazara political parties
title: Al-Nasr (Afghanistan)
